steps.1: Wash all the dals. Soak for 1 hour and then drain.
steps.2: Combine the dals, 2 cups of water, salt and turmeric powder, mix well and pressure cook for 3 whistles.
steps.3: Allow the steam to escape before opening the lid.
steps.4: Heat the ghee in a deep non-stick kadhai and add the cumin seeds.
steps.5: When the seeds crackle, add the onions and ginger-garlic paste and sauté on a medium flame for 1 minute.
steps.6: Add the tomatoes and 2 tbsp of water, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 2 minutes.
steps.7: Add the garam masala, chilli powder and coriander-cumin seeds powder, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 2 more minutes.
steps.8: Add the curds and coriander, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 1 to 2 minutes, while stirring continuously.
steps.9: Add the dals, mix well and cook on a slow flame for another 2 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
steps.10: Serve hot with rotis or parathas.

steps.1: Combine all the ingredients in a mixer and blend it to a coarse mixture using 2 tbsp of water.
steps.2: Heat the oil in a non-stick kadhai and drop small spoonfuls of the batter in it, a few at a time, and deep-fry till they turn golden brown in colour from all the sides. Drain on absorbent paper and keep aside.
steps.3: Combine the tomatoes and  ½ cup of water in a broad non-stick pan, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 3 minutes, while stirring occasionally. Keep aside to cool slightly.
steps.4: Blend it in a mixer to a smooth purée and strain it using a strainer. Keep aside.
steps.5: Heat the oil in a other broad non-stick pan, add the onions and sauté on a medium flame for 2 minutes.
steps.6: Add the prepared tomato purée, ginger paste, garlic paste, turmeric powder, chilli powder, garam masala, salt and sugar, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 2 minutes, while stirring continuously.
steps.7: Add the fresh cream, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 1 minute, while stirring occasionally. Keep aside.
steps.8: Combine all the ingredients along with 2 cups of water in a deep non-stick pan and mix well. Cover with a lid and cook on a medium flame for 10 minutes or till the rice is cooked, while stirring occasionally.
steps.9: Strain the rice using a strainer.
steps.10: Divide the rice into 2 equal portions and keep aside.
steps.11: Add the koftas to the tomato gravy and mix gently. Keep aside.
steps.12: Combine the milk and saffron in a small bowl, mix well and keep aside.
steps.13: Spread the a portion of the rice in a greased baking dish to form an even layer.
steps.14: Spread the tomato gravy with the koftas evenly over it.
steps.15: Finally spread the other portion of the rice evenly over it.
steps.16: Pour the prepared milk-saffron mixture and sprinkle the mint leaves evenly over it.
steps.17: Cover with an aluminium foil and bake it in a pre-heated oven at 200°c (400°f) for 10 minutes.

steps.1: Combine the whole wheat flour, ghee and salt in a bowl and mix well.
steps.2: Add enough water and knead into a semi-stiff dough. Keep aside.
steps.3: Heat the ghee in a broad non-stick pan and add the cumin seeds.
steps.4: When the seeds crackle, add the onions and sauté on a medium flame for 1 to 2 minutes.
steps.5: Add the green chillies, mix well and sauté on a medium flame for 1 minute.
steps.6: Add the potatoes, salt, chilli powder, coriander, dry mango powder, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 1 to 2 minutes, while stirring continuously.
steps.7: Divide the stuffing into 12 equal portions and keep aside.
steps.8: Divide the dough into 12 equal portions and roll a portion of the dough into a circle of of 100 mm. (4”) diameter circle.
steps.9: Place a little stuffing in the centre of the circle.
steps.10: Bring together all the sides in the centre and seal tightly.
steps.11: Roll again into a circle of 150 mm. (6”) diameter circle with a little flour.
steps.12: Heat a non-stick tava (griddle) and cook the paratha using a little ghee until golden brown spots appear on both the sides.
steps.13: Repeat with the remaining dough and stuffing to make 11 more parathas.

steps.1: Heat the oil in a broad non-stick pan, add onions and sauté on a medium flame till they turn translucent.
steps.2: Add ginger and green chillies and sauté on a medium flame for another 30 seconds.

6.text: Moong dal toast.. a great brefast recipe.. I prepared the batter a day before.. and just pan fried them in the morning.. a great recipe.. and filling to the stomach.. loved by all..

steps.1: Combine the yellow moong dal and enough water in a deep bowl and keep aside to soak for 2 hours. Drain well.
steps.2: Combine the soaked yellow moong dal and green chillies in a mixer and blend to a coarse mixture using approx. ¼ cup of water.
steps.3: Transfer the mixture into a deep bowl, add the cabbage, onions, asafoetida, besan, baking soda, lemon juice, coriander and salt and mix well.
steps.4: Divide the mixture into 10 equal portions.
steps.5: Place a bread slice on a clean, dry surface and spread a portion of the mixture evenly over it.
steps.6: Heat a non-stick tava (griddle) and grease it with oil.
steps.7: Place each open sandwich on the tava (griddle) with the topping side facing downwards and cook using oil, till it turns golden brown in colour from both the sides.
steps.8: Cut each toast into 2 diagonally.
steps.9: Serve immediately with tomato ketchup.

steps.1: Heat the ghee in a small pan, add all the ingredients and sauté on a slow flame while stirring continuously till the flavour releases (approx. 4 to 5 minutes).
steps.2: Allow it cool slightly and then blend in a mixer to a smooth powder. Keep aside.
steps.3: Combine the toovar dal, tomatoes, salt and 1 cup of water, mix well and pressure cook for 4 whistles.
steps.4: Allow the steam to escape before opening the lid. Whisk it lightly.
steps.5: Add 1½ tbsp of the prepared masala, mix well and simmer for 2 to 3 minutes.
steps.6: For the tempering, heat the ghee in a small pan and add the mustard seeds.
steps.7: When the seeds crackle, add the cumin seeds, red chillies and curry leaves and sauté for a few seconds.
steps.8: Pour the tempering over the dal mixture, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 1 minute.
steps.9: Remove from the flame and add the buttermilk and salt (if required) and mix well. Serve immediately.
steps.10: You require little quantity of the masala, however to grind such a less quantity is not feasible hence prepare it in bulk and store in an air-tight container to use later.

3.text: Best way to describe this sambar: a flavor explosion! I''m an American-born Bengali living in California. While I love Bengali food, our typical daily masoor daal preparation tends to be bland. The taste of Ms. Dalal''s sambar is wonderfully complex and worth the time it takes to roast the spices and procure curry leaf and (frozen) drumsticks from the Indian store. For cooks in the US, read Ms. Dalal''s explanation of drumsticks and you''ll understand why you won''t want to omit these ingredients. I used kabocha (Japanese pumpkin) for the red pumpkin - delicious. Thank you, Ms. Dalal!

steps.1: Combine the besan, semolina, sugar, ginger-green chilli paste, lemon juice and salt with approx. ¾ cup of water in a deep bowl and mix well using a whisk to get a smooth batter.
steps.2: Just before steaming, add the fruit salt and mix lightly.
steps.3: Pour the mixture immediately to a greased 175 mm. (7") diameter thali and spread evenly by rotating the thali clockwise.
steps.4: Steam in a steamer for 10 to 12 minutes or till the dhoklas are cooked. Keep aside.
steps.5: Heat the oil in a small non-stick pan and add the mustard seeds.
steps.6: When the seeds crackle, add the sesame seeds, asafoetida, curry leaves and green chillies and sauté on a medium flame for 30 seconds.
steps.7: Remove from the flame, add ½ cup of water and wait for 5 minutes or till the water is absorbed completely.
steps.8: Pour the tempering over the prepared dhoklas and spread it evenly.
steps.9: Cut into pieces, garnish with coriander and serve immediately with green chutney.

steps.1: Combine the sesame seeds, coconut, peanuts, ginger, garlic and onions in a broad non-stick pan and dry roast them over a slow flame for 3 minutes.
steps.2: Add the turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin seeds powder, chilli powder and tamarind pulp and blend to a smooth paste using ½ cup water. Keep aside.
steps.3: Slit the brinjals, lengthwise, into four, but leave the stems on, so the eggplants remain joined at the stem. Keep aside.
steps.4: Heat the oil in a deep non-stick pan, add the mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds and nigella seeds and sauté on a medium flame for 30 seconds.
steps.5: When the seeds crackle, add the brinjals, curry leaves and green chillies and sauté over medium flame for 3 minutes, while stirring occasionally. Remove the brinjals and keep aside.
steps.6: In the same pan, add the coconut and sesame paste, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 2 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
steps.7: Add the cooked brinjals, ½ cup of water and salt, mix gently and cover with a lid and cook on a medium flame for 5 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
steps.8: Serve hot garnished with coriander.

steps.1: Sieve the flour and salt together.
steps.2: Transfer it in a bowl, add the oil and knead into a soft dough using enough water. Keep aside.
steps.3: Heat the oil in a broad pan, add the onions and sauté on a medium flame till the onions turn golden brown in colour. Sprinkle a little water if required.
steps.4: Add the potatoes and green peas, mix well and cook on medium flame, till the potatoes are soft, while stirring at regular intervals. Sprinkle little water if required.
steps.5: Add the cabbage, ginger-green chilli paste, sugar, lemon juice and salt and mix well.
steps.6: Cover and cook on a slow flame for 5 minutes or till the vegetables are cooked.
steps.7: Remove from the flame, add the coriander and mix well.
steps.8: Cool slightly and divide the filling into 18 equal portions. Keep aside.
steps.9: Divide the dough into 6 equal portions.
steps.10: Roll out each portion into a very thin 200 mm. (8") diameter circle using a little wheat flour.
steps.11: Heat a non-stick tava (griddle) and cook each chapati on both sides for a few seconds.
steps.12: Divide each chapati into three long pieces and make a cone of each strip.
steps.13: Stuff a cone with a portion of the prepared filling.
steps.14: Seal the edges carefully with the help of the flour-water paste.
steps.15: Repeat the steps 5 ans 6 to make 17 more samosas.
steps.16: Heat the oil in kadhai and deep-fry a few samosas at a timr on a medium flame till they turn crisp and golden brown in colour from all the sides.
steps.17: Drain on an absorbent paper and serve hot with green chutney

steps.1: Soak the toovar dal in enough water in a deep bowl for 1 hour. Drain well.

steps.4: Whisk the dal using a whisk, add the tamarind pulp, green chillies, coriander , remaining ¼ tsp turmeric powder, coriander powder, chilli powder, salt, mix well and cook on medium flame for 3 to 4 minutes, while stirring occasionally. Keep aside.
steps.5: Heat the ghee in a small non-stick pan, add the cumin seeds, mustard seeds and sauté on medium flame for 30 seconds.
steps.6: Add asafoetida, curry leaves, remaining 1 tbsp of garlic, kashmiri red chillies and sauté on a medium flame for 1 minute.
steps.7: Pour the tempering over the dal and mix well.
steps.8: Serve hot with rice or rotis.

steps.1: Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and knead into a soft dough, adding enough water. Cover with a muslin cloth and keep aside for 15 minutes.
steps.2: Knead again using oil till smooth and divide the dough into 5 equal portions. Keep aside.
steps.3: Heat the oil in a kadhai  and add the cumin seeds.
steps.4: When the seeds crackle, add the coconut and sauté on a medium flame for a few minutes till they turn golden brown in colour.
steps.5: Add the ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, coriander-cumin seeds powder, chilli powder, chaat masala, kabuli chana and salt and coriander and  sauté on a medium flame for a few minutes.
steps.6: Mash a little using the back of spoon and keep aside to cool.
steps.7: Divide the stuffing into 5 equal portions and keep aside.
steps.8: Divide  the dough into 5 equal portions and roll out each into  a circle of 75 mm. (3”) diameter.
steps.9: Place a portion of the stuffing in the centre of the circle.
steps.10: Bring together all the sides in the centre and seal tightly.
steps.11: Roll out again into a circle of 125 mm. (5”) diameter with the help of a little flour.
steps.12: Cook on a hot tava (griddle), using ½ tsp of oil till brown spots appear on both the sides.
steps.13: Repeat with the remaining ingredients to make 4 more parathas.

2.text: This Paneer Tikka recipe is the most popular recipe in any North Indian restaurant, Every time I order it and always wanted to make it at home, now I know how to make it and it taste great.

steps.1: Combine the besan, curds, chaat masala, garam masala, ginger paste, garlic paste, chilli powder, oil and salt in a deep bowl and mix well using a whisk.
steps.2: Add the paneer, capsicum and onions and toss gently till they are evenly coated from all the sides.
steps.3: Thread a piece of paneer cube followed by 2 capsicum and 2 onion cubes alternatively. Again thread another piece of paneer cube followed by 2 capsicum and 2 onion cubes alternatively and finally thread a paneer cube on a skewer or a long tooth pick.
steps.4: Repeat with the remaining ingredients to make 3 more tikkas.
steps.5: Grease a non-stick tava (griddle) with oil, place the prepared tikkas over it and cook them on a medium flame, using oil till they turn golden brown in colour from all the sides.
steps.6: Repeat step 5 to cook the remaining 2 paneer tikkas in one more batch. Keep aside.
steps.7: Combine the cornflour and 1 cup of water in a deep bowl, mix well and keep aside.
steps.8: Heat the oil in a deep non-stick kadhai, add the cinnamon, cloves, garlic paste and ginger paste and sauté on a medium flame for a few seconds.
steps.9: Add the onion paste and salt and sauté on a medium flame for 2 to 3 minutes.
steps.10: Add the fresh tomato pulp, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 2 to 3 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
steps.11: Add the chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander-cumin seeds powder, fresh cream, coriander and cornflour-water mixture, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 2 to 3 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
steps.12: Just before serving, re-heat the gravy and slide the paneer tikkas from the skewers into the gravy. Mix gently and cook on a medium flame for 2 minutes, while stirring occasionally.

steps.1: Combine the plain flour, custard powder and baking powder in a strainer and sieve it to make a plain flour-custard powder mixture. Keep aside.
steps.2: Combine the butter and sugar in a deep bowl and cream it gently using a spatula.
steps.3: Add the tutti frutti, rose essence and cashewnuts and mix well.
steps.4: Add the plain flour-custard powder mix and knead into a soft dough using milk.
steps.5: Divide the dough into 2 equal portions and roll each portion of the dough into 150 mm (6”) in length and 50 mm. (2”) diameter cylindrical roll and wrap them in cling wrap.
steps.6: Refrigerate the dough for 15 to 20 minutes.
steps.7: Cut each cylindrical roll into10 small rounds of approx. 50 mm. (2”) in diameter with the help of a sharp knife.
steps.8: Arrange the biscuits on a baking tray and bake in a pre-heated oven at 180°c (360°f) for 30 minutes.
steps.9: Cool completely and store in an air tight container. Use as required.

steps.1: Heat 1 tbsp of ghee in a broad non-stick pan, add the coconut and sesame seeds and sauté on a medium flame for 2 minutes. Keep aside.
steps.2: Combine the whole wheat flour and ½ cup of water in a deep bowl and knead into a stiff dough.
steps.3: Divide the dough into 8 equal portions and shape each portion into the shape of your fist and press with your fingers in the centre of each portion to make an indentation.
steps.4: Heat the ghee in a deep non-stick kadhai and deep-fry 4 dough portions at a time, on a medium flame for 20 minutes or till they turn golden brown in colour from all the sides. Drain on an absorbent paper and allow them to cool.
steps.5: Repeat step 4 to deep-fry 4 more dough portions.
steps.6: Once cooled, break them into small pieces and blend in a mixer to a fine powder. Keep aside.
steps.7: Heat the remaining 3 tbsp of ghee in a broad non-stick pan, add the jaggery and 1 tbsp of water, mix well and cook on a slow flame for 3 to 4 minutes, while stirring continuously. Keep the churma aside.
steps.8: Combine the churma, coconut-sesame seeds mixture, melted jaggery and milk in a deep bowl and mix very well. Allow the mixture to cool slightly.
steps.9: Divide the mixture into 10 equal portions and shape each portion into a round ball and roll in the poppy seeds till they are evenly coated from all the sides.
steps.10: Serve immediately or store in an air-tight container.

steps.1: Drain the rice and blend in a mixer to a coarse paste adding water as required (approximately ¼ cup). Keep aside.
steps.2: Drain the urad dal and blend in a mixer to a smooth paste adding water as required (approximately 2 tbsp). Keep aside.
steps.3: Combine the rice and urad dal paste together in a bowl, add the ginger-green chilli paste, oil and salt and mix well. Cover and keep aside for 15 to 20 minutes.
steps.4: Just before steaming sprinkle the fruit salt and add 2 tsp of water over it.
steps.5: When the bubbles form, mix gently.
steps.6: Pour a ladleful of batter immediately into a greased 175 mm. (7") diameter thali and shake the thali clockwise to spread it to make an even layer.
steps.7: Sprinkle a pinch of black pepper powder evenly over it and steam for 7 to 8 minutes or till the dhoklas are cooked.
steps.8: Cool slightly and cut into equal portions.
steps.9: Repeat with the remaining batter to make 3 more thalis. Serve immediately.
steps.10: Khatta dhokla: to the above rice and urad dal batter simply add ¼ cup of beaten curds, 6 to 8 whole peppercorns and ½ tsp of fenugreek seeds (in step no. 3), mix well and let it ferment for atleast 6 to 8 hours and follow the procedure as above.

5.text: Rotla.. i was searching for this bajra recipe of rotla.. as everyone does not know how to make it.. but now i have learnt how to make it.. and my familky just enjoys this with garlic chutney or with any subzi.. it taste best when it is hot and straight out from the flame. super delicious..

steps.1: Sieve the flour and salt together in a deep bowl.
steps.2: Add enough lukewarm water and knead into a semi- soft dough. Keep kneading for 3 to 4 minutes or till the dough is very smooth.
steps.3: Divide the dough into 6 equal portions.
steps.4: Roll a portion of the dough into a 125 mm. (5") diameter circle, using a little bajra flour for rolling.
steps.5: Heat a non-stick tava (griddle) on a high flame and when hot, place the rotla gently over it.
steps.6: Cook it till small blisters appear on the surface. Turn over the rotla and cook for a few more seconds.
steps.7: Cook it on an open flame till it puffs up and brown spots appear on both the sides.
steps.8: Repeat with the remaining dough portions to make 5 more rotlas.
steps.9: Serve immediately with garlic chutney, jaggery and ghee.

steps.1: Combine all the ingredients and 2 cups of water in a deep non-stick pan, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 8 to 10 minutes, while stirring occasionally. Keep aside to cool completely.
steps.2: Once cooled, blend in a mixer till smooth. Keep aside.
steps.3: Heat the oil in a deep non-stick pan, add the cauliflower, french beans, carrot, capsicum and potatoes and sauté on a high flame for 3 to 4 minutes or till the vegetables turn light brown in colour.
steps.4: Switch off the flame, drain the vegetables in a bowl and keep aside.
steps.5: Reheat the left over oil in the same deep non-stick pan, add the cinnamon, cardamom, cloves and the gravy mixture, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 8 to 10 minutes or till the oil begins to separate, while stirring continuously.
steps.6: Add the turmeric powder, chilli powder, garam masala, salt and ½ cup of water, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 2 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
steps.7: Add the sautéed vegetables, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 4 to 5 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
steps.8: Serve hot with rotis or parathas.

steps.1: Combine the potatoes, cornflour and salt in a bowl and mix well.
steps.2: Divide the potato mixture into 8 equal portions and roll each portion into a 75 mm. (2 ½ ") diameter circle. Place 1 tsp of the prepared stuffing in the centre.
steps.3: Bring together the edges in the centre to seal the filling inside the potato circle.
steps.4: Repeat with the remaining potato mixture and stuffing to make 7 more stuffed patties.
steps.5: Cook the patties on a non-stick tava (griddle), using a little oil, till they turn brown in colour from both the sides. Keep aside.
steps.6: Drain the safed vatana. Add the salt and 11/2 cups of water and pressure cook for 4 whistles.
steps.7: Before opening the lid allow the steam to escape. Keep aside.
steps.8: Heat the oil in a non-stick pan and add the mustard seeds, curry leaves and asafoetida.
steps.9: When the seeds crackle, add all the remaining ingredients along with the cooked safed vatana and ¾ cup of water, mix well while mashing the safed vatana slightly so that the gravy thickens.
steps.10: Simmer for 10 minutes, while stirring twice in between and keep aside.
steps.11: Just before serving, place 2 patties in a plate and pour 1/4th of the hot ragda over it.
steps.12: Top it with 1 tbsp khajur imli ki chutney, 2 tbsp of sev and 1 tbsp of onions.
steps.14: The mint mixture for the stuffing  should be kept in a strainer after grinding  once made to allow the excess water to be drained, which will make stuffing the patties easier.

steps.1: Squeeze out all the excess water from the bottle gourd.
steps.2: Combine the quinoa flour, besan, semolina, bottle gourd, 1 tsp oil, green chilli paste, soda, ¼ tsp of asafoetida, turmeric powder, sugar, lemon juice and salt in a deep bowl, mix well and knead into a soft dough using ¼ cup of water.
steps.3: Apply ¼ tsp of oil on your hands and divide the mixture into 4 equal portions.
steps.4: Shape each portion into approximately 150 mm. (6”) length and 25 mm. (1”) in diameter cylindrical roll.
steps.5: Arrange 2 rolls on a greased sieve and steam in a steamer for 12 minutes or till a knife inserted into the muthia comes out clean.
steps.6: Repeat step 5 to steam 1 more batch.
steps.7: Remove, cool slightly and cut into 25 mm. (1“) slices using a sharp knife. Keep aside.
steps.8: For the tempering, heat the remaining 6 tsp of oil in a broad non-stick pan and add the mustard seeds, sesame seeds, curry leaves, and remaining ¼ tsp of asafoetida and sauté on a medium flame for a few seconds.
steps.9: Add the muthia pieces and sauté on a medium flame for 3 to 4 minutes.
steps.10: Serve immediately garnished with coriander.

steps.2: Combine the bottle gourd, onions, whole wheat flour, semolina, besan, ginger-green chilli paste, turmeric powder, cumin seeds, fennel seeds, lemon juice, sugar, coriander, soda bi-carb, asafoetida, salt and 1 tsp of oil in a bowl, mix well and knead into a soft dough adding water if required (use th

steps.4: Shape each portion into a cylindrical roll approximately 150 mm. (6") length and 25 mm. (1") in diameter.
steps.5: Arrange the rolls on a greased sieve and steam in a steamer for 20 to 25 minutes.
steps.6: Remove, cool slightly and cut into 12 mm. (½”) slices and keep aside.
steps.7: For the tempering, heat the remaining 2 tsp of oil in a non-stick kadhai and add the mustard seeds.
steps.8: When the seeds crackle, add the sesame seeds and asafoetida and sauté on a medium flame for a few seconds.
steps.9: Add the muthia pieces and sauté on a medium flame for 2 to 3 minutes or till they turn light brown in colour and crisp.
steps.10: Serve immediately garnished with coriander.

steps.1: Combine the cow’s milk and buffalo’s milk in a broad and deep non-stick pan and bring to a boil.
steps.2: Switch of the flame and wait for 1 minute, while stirring occasionally.
steps.3: Add the lemon juice gradually and keep stirring gently.
steps.4: Allow it to stand for ½ minute to curdle. It is completely curdled, when the chenna and the whey (greenish water) separate out.
steps.5: Strain using a muslin cloth. Discard or store the whey.
steps.6: Place the muslin cloth with the chenna in a bowl of fresh water and wash it 2 to 3 times.
steps.7: Tie and hang for 30 minutes for the extra water to drain out.
steps.8: Put 5 cups of water in a steamer or a pressure cooker, add the sugar and bring to a boil, while stirring occasionally so that the sugar dissolves completely.
steps.9: Meanwhile, squeeze the muslin cloth to drain any more water remaining.
steps.10: Place the muslin cloth on a flat plate, open it and knead the chenna very well using your palms for 3 to 4 minutes or till the chenna is smooth and free of lumps.
steps.11: Divide the chenna into 16 equal portions and roll each portion into small balls between your palms.
steps.12: Put the chenna balls into the sugar water and cover and steam for 7 to 8 minutes.
steps.13: Switch off the flame and allow it to stand in the steamer for 10 to 15 minutes.
steps.14: Remove gently into a bowl, refrigerate and serve chilled.
steps.15: If buffalo’s milk is not available you can make the recipe using 5 cups of cow’s milk.

9.text:
Last winter I passed by a group of Gujrati speaking ladies , one of whom was saying " Fada ni khichdi kari hathi. Bahu fine laagi.. " I'd never heard the name nor did I know what the main ingredient was . A general (superficial)  google search later, I initially dismissed  it as a fanciful name for the  'namkeen dalia ", I'd been making. 

Out of curiosity for Tarla aunty's version and of course having successfully attempted some of her recipes earlier, I checked the recipe on this website and noticed that the ingredients were considerably different although the method was probably simpler than what I was doing. What I was cooking was wholesome but the gujarati version as interpreted by Tarla aunty was exactly what you could call a complete one dish meal with the nutrients also intact. 

If I have the vegetables required, then this is what I cook on the spur. The best part is that I still haven't tasted it made by an authentic gujarati or even at a restaurant. All the same it tasted good each time I made it and my family agrees. Thank-you Tarla aunty!

steps.5: Allow the steam to escape before opening the lid.

steps.7: Garnish with coriander and serve hot with fresh curds.

2.text: 4 flour dosa, this recipe is just so yumm, tasty which includes different kinds of flour, with right propotion of urad dal. No one can tel there is so many flours in it. I have loved this recipe so much that i have started making this very often.

steps.1: Combine the urad dal and fenugreek seeds in a deep bowl and soak it for 2 hours in enough water.
steps.2: Drain well and blend in a mixer till smooth using approx. ¾ cup of water.
steps.3: Transfer the mixture into a deep bowl, add the bajra flour, jowar flour, nachni flour, whole wheat flour, salt and approx. 1¾ cups of water and mix very well using a whisk. Cover with a lid and keep aside to ferment overnight.
steps.4: Next day, mix very well again.
steps.5: Heat a non-stick tava (griddle), sprinkle a little water on the tava (griddle) and wipe it off gently using a muslin cloth.
steps.6: Pour a ladleful of the batter on it and spread it in a circular motion to make a 200 mm. (8”) diameter thin circle.
steps.7: Smear ¼ tsp of oil over it and along the edges and cook on a medium flame till the dosa turns brown in colour and crisp from both the sides.
steps.8: Fold over to make a semi-circle or a roll.
steps.9: Repeat with the remaining batter to make 11 more dosas.
steps.10: Serve immediately with sambhar.

steps.1: Combine the flour and salt together in a bowl and add enough water to make soft dough.
steps.2: Knead well for 3 to 4 minutes and keep aside.
steps.3: Heat the oil in a non-stick pan and fry the fennel seeds in it for a few seconds.
steps.4: Add the onions and sauté till they turn golden brown in colour.
steps.5: Add the green chillies, turmeric powder, ginger, amchur  cabbage and 1 tbsp of water and mix well and cook on a medium flame for 1 minute.
steps.6: Add the moong dal and cook for another 2 minutes.
steps.7: Add the salt and mint and mix very well.
steps.8: Remove from the flame divide into 6 equal portions and keep aside.
steps.9: Divide the dough into 6 equal portions.
steps.10: Roll out each portion of the dough into a circle of about 100 mm. (4") diameter using a little flour for rolling.
steps.11: Place 1 portion of the stuffing in the centre of the circle.
steps.12: Bring together all the sides in the centre and seal tightly.
steps.13: Roll out again into a circle of 150 mm. (5") diameter using a little wheat flour for rolling.
steps.14: Cook on a non-stick pan on both sides using ¼ teaspoon oil until brown spots appear.
steps.15: Repeat with the remaining dough and stuffing to make 5 more parathas.

steps.1: Clean, wash and soak the green moong dal in a deep bowl in enough water for 2 to 3 hours. Drain well.
steps.2: Combine the green moong dal, green chillies and curds in a mixer and blend till smooth.
steps.3: Transfer the mixture into a deep bowl, add all the remaining ingredients and mix well. Keep aside.
steps.4: Heat the oil in a broad non-stick pan and add the cumin seeds.
steps.5: When the seeds crackle, add the onions and green chillies and sauté on a medium flame for 1 minute.
steps.6: Add the potatoes, coriander, chilli powder, dried mango powder and salt, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 2 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
steps.7: Divide the stuffing into 4 equal portions. Keep aside.
steps.8: Heat a non-stick tava (griddle), grease it lightly with oil, sprinkle a little water on it (it should sizzle immediately) and wipe off using a wet piece of cloth.
steps.9: Pour ¼th of the batter on the tava (griddle) and spread in a circular motion to make a 175 mm. (7") thin chila.
steps.10: Smear little oil on the edges of the chila.
steps.11: Spread a portion of the potato stuffing evenly over the chila using a spatula and cook till the chila turns golden brown in colour.
steps.12: Fold over using a spatula, while pressing it lightly to make a flat roll.
steps.13: Repeat with the remaining batter and stuffing to make 3 more rolls.
steps.14: Cut each roll into 4 equal pieces and serve immediately.

steps.1: Combine all the ingredients, except the ghee, in a bowl and mix well.
steps.2: Heat the ghee in a kadhai, add the prepared mixture and cook for 2 to 3 minutes.
steps.3: Allow the mixture to cool and divide it into 4 equal portions.

steps.6: Cook the kebabs (approx. 3 to 4 minutes) over a charcoal or electric barbeque till they are evenly browned on all sides.
steps.7: Cut each kebab into 3 pieces and serve hot with phudina chutney and lemon wedges.

steps.1: Combine the dry yeast, sugar and 1½ tbsp of warm water in a bowl, mix well and cover and keep aside for 10 minutes.
steps.2: Combine all the ingredients, including the yeast mixture into a deep bowl and knead into a soft dough using enough water.
steps.3: Cover with a damp muslin cloth and keep aside for 30 minutes.
steps.4: Divide the dough into 8 equal portions.
steps.5: Roll a portion of the dough into a 150 mm. (6”) diameter circle using a little whole wheat flour for rolling.
steps.6: Heat a non-stick tava (griddle) on a high flame and when hot, place the roti gently over it.
steps.7: Cook it till small blisters appear on the surface. Turn over the roti and cook for few more seconds.
steps.8: Cook it on an open flame till it puffs up and brown spots appear on both the sides.
steps.9: Repeat with the remaining dough portions to make 7 more rotis.
steps.10: Serve immediately.

2.text: amazingly quick... as usually with the rice phirni... we have to keep cooking the phirni till the rice cooks and that's when the milk thickens.. but here by using poha.. the time has almost reduced to less that half the time... and for people with a sweet tooth who cant resist the wait... try this recipe... i loved it warm too.. so indulge in..!!!

steps.1: Roast the poha in a broad non-stick pan for 1 to 2 minutes or till crisp, while stirring continuously.
steps.2: Remove from the flame, cool and grind in a mixer to a coarse powder. Keep aside.
steps.3: Boil the milk and sugar in another broad non-stick pan, scrapping the sides, while stirring continuously
steps.4: Add the coarsely ground poha, mix well and cook on a slow flame for 3 to 4 minutes, while stirring continuously.
steps.5: Add the cornflour-milk mixture, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 2 to 3 minutes, while stirring continuously.
steps.6: Cool and keep refrigerated for atleast 1 hour.
steps.7: Divide the phirni into 4 equal portions.
steps.8: Divide the fruits into 4 equal portions.
steps.9: Place a portion of fruits in a serving bowl, top with a portion of phirni.
steps.10: Repeat step 9 to make 3 more servings.
steps.11: Serve immediately garnished with almond slivers.

3.text: Paratha made from Moong Dal and whole wheat flour and spiced with dhania, green chillies and onion. Tastes great and goes with curd.Healthy!

steps.1: Clean, wash and soak the moong dal in enough water in a bowl for 2 to 3 hours. Drain well.
